definition: to peep/to peek/to steal a glance
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

sentences.english: When you peep out the successful smiling face.
sentences.chinese: 當你外面偷看時成功微笑的臉。

sentences.english: Office workers in South Korea have been trying various ways to peek at the Olympic matches during working hours.
sentences.chinese: 爲在上班時間偷看奧運比賽，韓國上班族花樣百出。

sentences.english: I knew perfectly well my note was purloined .
sentences.chinese: 我那張字條是讓人偷看了。

sentences.english: Franklin: I peeked at one letter, that's all.
sentences.chinese: 我只偷看了一個字母，就這麼多。

sentences.english: That woman discovered that her husband peeped into her diary.
sentences.chinese: 那位婦女發現他丈夫偷看她的日記。

sentences.english: Didn't your mother ever tell you not to pry?
sentences.chinese: 難到你媽媽沒告訴你偷看是很沒禮貌的嗎？

sentences.english: He took a peep through the door.
Bernard, unobserved, had watched the meeting between the two.
sentences.chinese: 伯納德偷看這爺倆見面沒有引起任何人的注意。

sentences.english: The boy stole a look at his father with grimace.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩扮着鬼臉偷看了他父親一眼。

sentences.english: It's rude to peep at other people's work.
sentences.chinese: 偷看別人的工作是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: The man peeped in through a crack.
sentences.chinese: 那個人透過縫隙向裏偷看。

sentences.english: I peeked at one letter, that's all.
sentences.chinese: 我只偷看了一個字母，就這麼。

sentences.english: She stole a glance at Martin.
Pace looks like he is taking a sneaky peek!
sentences.chinese: 圖中佩斯的表情好像是偷看到了對手的牌。

sentences.english: I listened to my classmates tell painful stories of the first time they noticed men ogling their bodies.
sentences.chinese: 傾聽同學講述第一次發現自己被男的偷看的慘痛經歷。

sentences.english: Night Yang who spy on misty rain over the wall, at the same time the misty rain guess fixed identity.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚陽明君翻牆偷看煙雨，同時煙雨猜出世子身份。

definition: to peep/to peek/to act as voyeur
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
to eat on the sly/to pilfer food/to be unfaithful
to take liberties with a woman/to dally/to assail a woman with obscenities
